Posts.Content: Melrosemelrose wrote: I have flown several times with a fiber foob.  At the security check, I've told them what I'm wearing and go through the body scanner and have had a pat down.  I now have a silicon foob and wonder if I should carry on the foob or wear it?  I'm travelling in a few days and would love to hear others experiences with the TSA and how they have handled the foob situation at the security check.  Chemo 4/24/2012Taxotere/Cytoxan X 6 & Herceptin B-47 clinical trial:4/24.5/15.6/5/,6/26,7/17.8/7. DX 2/17/2012 Encapsulated DCIS 4cm/IDC 2cm, ER+/PR-/HER2- (+1), Stage IIb, Grade 3,0/5 Nodes Surgery 2/15/2012 Lumpectomy: Left Surgery 3/14/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel; Mastectomy: Left Targeted Therapy 4/24/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 4/24/2012 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 9/6/2012 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Foobs and Airport Security Check Melrosemelrose Erica
